intro: Pisum sativum var. jessenii, commonly known as the Jessen's pea, is a botanical variant of the common pea. It is characterized by its distinctive pod morphology and seed coloration. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as for its edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of pink or white flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
